MEASUREMENTS. Body length (except the head): 9.5 mm , pronotum width: 6.0 mm.
ELYTRA. Striae narrow, always distinct; interstriae wide, flat.
ABDOMEN. Ventrites with few setae, chagrinated, black and blue.
PARAMERES. Flattened laterally; on lateral view, apical portion with a long sinuosity; on dorsal view, central membranous portion enlarged in the centre ( Fig. 6 A–B).

INTERNAL SAC. Fronto-lateral peripheral sclerite (FLP) involving axial sclerite (A), forming a central duct with spiniform apex; subaxial sclerite (SA) absent; medial peripheral sclerite (MP) semicircular, widely emarginated, with the internal margin with a lobe on the extremity (without central tooth); external margin sinuous with a lobe on the extremity, lobes separated by a U-shaped margin; apex of FLP + A involved by MP; superior right peripheral sclerite (SRP) circular with lateral prolongation in the dorsoventral direction ( Fig. 6 C–D).

MORPHOLOGICAL VARIATION. Body length (except the head) ranges from 9.5 mm to 12 mm ; pronotum width from 6 to 7.5 mm . Pronotum with bright reflections, according to the viewing angle, between different intensities of green, red and yellow.

For a long time, this species was identified as
Canthon auricollis Redtenbacher, 1868
, but the examination of the type specimens of both nominal species allowed Vaz-de-Mello & Cupello (2018a) to conclude that, in fact, the latter name refers to a another species belonging to
Canthon
s. str. , closely related to
C. lividus Blanchard, 1846
. It is an insect that can be considered very rare and can only be collected at altitudes usually over 1000 m . The predominance of pronotal sheen varies from golden yellow to red.
High altitude in the Atlantic Forest along the coast of Brazil , in the states of Minas Gerais , Espírito Santo and Rio de Janeiro ( Fig. 10 ).
